body_text:
In the user selector here we expect a state object:
https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/users/selectors.js#L3
But when we call into it here, we look up a field on the state object (which could be undefined) and pass that in:
https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/serviceInfo/selectors.js#L5
Looks like we should just be passing the state?
body_html:
In the user selector here we expect a state object:

https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/users/selectors.js#L3

But when we call into it here, we look up a field on the state object (which could be undefined) and pass that in:

https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/serviceInfo/selectors.js#L5

Looks like we should just be passing the state?
title: 'state is undefined' in users/selectors.js
body:
In the user selector here we expect a state object:

https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/users/selectors.js#L3

But when we call into it here, we look up a field on the state object (which could be undefined) and pass that in:

https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/blob/redesign/recipe-server/client/control_new/state/app/serviceInfo/selectors.js#L5

Looks like we should just be passing the state?
